column4: This shouldn't be that hard to fix... I just need to change my video driver back to the radeon driver... why is there no xorg.conf file?
you mean the open source radeon driver?
I'm not sure if the xorg.conf is necessary, but this is what I have: http://pastie.org/1472452
I'm using edgers, but I installed an Nvidia card to see if it worked [9500 1024MB], and now I want to revert to the open source ATI radeon driver.
and what do you have at the moment? AFAIK it couldn't be using the nvidia driver because that wouldn't work
right, so if you still have xorg-edgers installed then just try dropping that config into your xorg.conf file (create it if it doesn't exist)
if you mean the ATI propietry drivers, they're called fglrx
no, not the proprietary, the FOSS radeon driver.
xorg-edgers is the latest version of the radeon driver plus more recent versions of X and related libraries that have to be updated for  the latest radeon drivers to work
so basically you'll want to purge/get rid of whatever you have before and set the card to use the radeon driver
yes, I know. I'm trying to get the edgers version of radeon to function again, since installing an Nvidia card broke it when I uninstalled the nvidia driver
oh, so just reinstall the xorg-edgers ppa
and add what I linked to your xorg.conf
this look good before I reboot? http://pastie.org/1472481
I'd say probably... I'm not an expert with xorg conf ;)
